= Redisql's Documentation =

The documentation is a work in progress.

  * Redisql can do a lot of things, check out [http://code.google.com/p/redisql/wiki/CommandReference CommandReference]
  * Redisql is VERY fast, scales well when joining, and runs in swap with style, check out [http://code.google.com/p/redisql/wiki/Benchmarks Benchmarks]
  * Ways to unleash the power of Redisql, w/ examples in code :) check out [http://code.google.com/p/redisql/wiki/Examples Examples]

  * Want to write a client, or extend an existing one, best to have a firm grasp of the [http://code.google.com/p/redisql/wiki/Protocol Redisql Protocol]

  * Stable releases packed up into hearty [http://code.google.com/p/redisql/downloads/list Code Tarballs]
  * Development branch code, fork at will via [http://github.com/JakSprats/Redisql Github]


  * PHP clients rock, check out [http://github.com/JakSprats/predis Predisql] and [http://github.com/JakSprats/Rediska Redisqlska]
  * [http://github.com/JakSprats/redis-rb Ruby client] (fork of redis-rb)
  * Node.js client coming real soon

  * Jaksprats (author) [http://jaksprats.wordpress.com/ blog] discussing the strengths and uses of Redisql
